db:abstract.db:para: The QQuickPalette class contains color groups for each QML item state.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A palette consists of three color groups: Active, Disabled, and Inactive. Active color group is the default group, its colors are used for other groups if colors of these groups aren't explicitly specified.
In the following example, color is applied for all color groups:
It means that text color will be the same for both buttons.

This approach is convenient when you need to specify a whole palette with all color groups.

db:section.db:title: active : QQuickColorGroup
db:section.db:para: The Active group is used for windows that are in focus.

db:section.db:title: disabled : QQuickColorGroup
db:section.db:para: The Disabled group is used for elements that are disabled for some reason.

db:section.db:title: inactive : QQuickColorGroup
db:section.db:para: The Inactive group is used for windows that have no keyboard focus.
